DOC.brief_summary: Phosphorus-based food additive commonly use food manufacturer many application , enhance flavor , ready-to-eat food beverage . While additive significantly increase individual 's daily phosphorus intake , little known effect dietary phosphorus kidney health . In study , investigator first low baseline phosphorus intake 1000mg/d educate participant avoid food phosphorus additive . Then , participant randomize high phosphorus period ( ~2gm/d ) low phosphorus period ( ~1gm/d ) providing unaltered , commercially-available food/beverage product without phosphorus additive . The investigator hypothesize participant high urine albumin excretion fibroblast growth factor-23 high phosphorus period compare low phosphorus period .

DOC.criteria: Adults least 21 year age least microalbuminuria Estimated glomerular filtration rate < 45ml/min/1.73m2 , poorly control diabetes hypertension , nephrotic syndrome , hyperparathyroidism , Paget 's Disease , multiple myeloma , uncontrolled thyroid disease , chronic antacid use , use phosphorus binder , phosphorus supplement , highdose vitamin D , inability complete feeding study , investigator discretion
